alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 12:22PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT/230 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Franklin. In Panhandle Florida, Gulf. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT /230 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1221 PM EDT /1121 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carrabelle, Apalachicola, Franklin, Creels, Hays Place, Bay City, High Bluff, Apalachicola Airport, Tilton, Royal Bluff, Nine Mile, Eleven Mile, Yent Place, Carrabelle Beach, Odena, Thirteen Mile, Indian Pass and Lanark Village. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
